pros: BTC cares about employees and members. Great non-profit company
cons: They try to stick to hiring LCSW over LPC

job_title: Qualified Behavior Technician in Benton, AR
cons: They were extremely understaffed and high turnover rate.

pros: You are able to help a vulnerable community
cons: Pay is low for the demand

pros: Amazing staff and even more amazing members

job_title: Qualified Behavioral Health Provider in Russellville, AR
pros: you will become part of a great team.
cons: Be prepared to be passed over for promotion

review_title: No way to move any further up without a masters degree.
pros: Build your work experience to take elsewhere. Has to be a similar field, though.

review_title: The people are great, but unrealistic expectations and continuous pressure to bill.
pros: The people who receive services are great. It is a great place to learn. Most of the staff are pleasant. Meals are provided to direct care staff. Training staff are engaging and very helpful.
cons: RSPMI billing. Company values the people they serve, but place this value above that of keeping workers safe, at times. Poor benefit package and poorly organized in providing information needed for health care benefits. Requirements are to document concurrently, which is often not possible due to slow computers or no computer available. Bonus is based on unrealistic expectations for billing (and is based on a formula that changes frequently with changes not being communicated), instead of being based on whether prescribed services for the client are met.  Weekly emails provide all employee billing accomplishments/requirements so that if billing is not met, all your colleagues will know which is not reinforcing of a cohesive environment, but of a competitive one.

pros: They care about the people they are trying to help. Great non-profit company.
cons: Focused on numbers more than quality interventions. However, this is changing, and improvements in this area are increasing.

pros: They will hire you for sure.
cons: No supervision of mental health patients and staff get injured or nearly murdered frequently. Not a good job if you have family to go home to.

review_title: Fulfilling with regard to the relationships built with the clients, but an exorbitant amount of pressure to do the job.
pros: Being a part of progress and recovery in someone's life, humbling experiences when working with the clients, most direct care staff are fully committed to their jobs, depending on which site at which you are working, community outreach to involve clients in outside environment, training staff are very helpful.
cons: Constant pressure to meet unrealistic goals of RSPMI billing, continuous change with little support provided in order to balance the impact of changes, low pay when compared to work demands, initial training cannot fully encompass the tasks that are demanded from direct care staff, pay cuts from salary if billable services are not provided to meet daily quota, continuous demands from management to do more or improve beyond given means, safety of staff is often compromised in order to meet prescribed quotas, high turnover rate for direct care staff, bonuses and incentives have been cut, must take personal time before sick time can be used, no paid holidays or weather policies, quality of benefits have decreased, favoritism among staff that damages relationships with clients, and no support with regard to loan forgiveness, cost of continuing education, or other required expenses often covered by other companies.

job_title: Mental Health Para in Russellville, AR
pros: The people who work at Birch Tree Communities are there because they care about people.  Most of the people are wonderful to work with.  The experience can be both frustrating and rewarding.  I enjoyed the work.  Good benefits including discounted prescriptions.  I love the ideals they uphold and live by.  There are some members I will never forget.
cons: It can be emotionally taxing.  I wasn't crazy about the shift. Sometimes it is difficult to work within the time constraints.

pros: Sign language, communication skills, life skills, coordination of schedules, coordination of student IEP protocol, staff and professional development, continuing education, etc. CPR and First Aid Certification obtained at this employer. RBT course training offered but declined. Most experience in school settings.
cons:
Communication among staff/between hierarchies 
Boundaries and expectations of employment unclear 
Low salary but amazing benefits!

review_title: Love my job, most of the time
pros: Watching people grow and be able to move on to the next chapter of they're lives
cons: unrealistic documentation expectations and some of the staff can be petty

job_title: Chief Financial Officer in Benton, AR
pros: It is a great place to have a rewarding job.  The focus is on helping people that truly need it.
cons: Often who you can help and how you can help them is restricted by the program (government) rules.

review_title: Love the members but not the administration
pros: Overtime, flexibility, fun coworkers, open shifts
cons: No communication, no room to grow

review_title: If you love life, do not work here!
cons: Management changing constantly. Way below average median pay. Management does not care about staff, just themselves and their bonuses. Hateful backstabbing and hs drama. Avoid this place at all costs!
